description: a(n) = number of squarefree numbers among C(n,k), k=0..n.
comments: The only odd numbers are at n = 0, 2, 4, and 8. So this sequence is essentially twice A238337. - _T. D. Noe_, Mar 07 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
example: If n=20, then C(20, k) is squarefree for k = 0,2,4,8,12,16,18,20, that is, for 8 cases of k, so a(20)=8.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k=0, n, issquarefree(binomial(n, k))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 19 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_
